User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the App Navigator application.

email.description: The email address of the user.

description.description: A short description of the community.

creatorId.description: The UID of the user who created the community.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the community was created.

definition.description: Stores user data. Path-based ownership ensures only the authenticated user (userId) can access their own data.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user, matching the Firebase Authentication UID.

definition.description: Stores community data. Any authenticated user can create and view communities.

params.name: communityId
params.description: The unique identifier of the community.

firestore.reasoning: The structure is straightforward. The `/users/{userId}` collection uses path-based ownership for secure user data storage. The `/communities` collection is designed for public access among authenticated users, allowing them to list, create, and view communities, with write access (update/delete) restricted to the original creator of a community.
